task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 272°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the full building (base to roof) in view to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera up first while keeping the current heading toward the building.
The view is now pointing north and up, so I must rotate back to the west (270°) while keeping the upward pitch to capture the building’s top for height estimation.
I need to see the roofline and overall facade clearly, so I should tilt up while staying aimed west at the building.
The camera keeps snapping to north after tilting, so I should rotate left to west (270°) while maintaining the upward pitch to view the building’s top.
To estimate height I must capture both the base and roof, so I will first look up to find the roofline and then can look down if needed.
I need to be facing west to see the target building, so I will rotate left to 270° while keeping the current upward pitch.
Repeated pitch changes appear to reset heading, so I should keep heading fixed and instead move to adjust vantage, stepping left to potentially see the building’s full height.
